Vincenzo,

I looked at your procedure against commands executed by the Makefile
and src/makefile,
and it seems it should work, at least.  

There could be a problem if  the version of the gcc  compiler used to
compile FLUENT and the compiler 
you used to compile your udf's and/or Cantera.   Have you inquired on
the FLUENT-forum at 
www.cfd-online.com.   

The other problem could be that certain macro-functions used
in accessing FLUENT data, change slightly depending on whether
the library is being compiled for a 2d or 3d version of FLUENT.   I
think, 
using the file "Makefile" takes care of this.   

Dave



>>> vmulone@... 4/13/2004 1:00:08 PM >>>
Dear Dave,
first of all thank you for your precious information, and sorry for 
the inconvenience of further questions, but it still (unfortunately)
doesn't work!!
I tried to follow your suggestions, I modified my src/makefile, but 
linking operation is not so clear to me.

I compiled the c functions by using gcc:
gcc -fpic -shared -ansi -Wall (Include dirs ...) -c udf_names.c
gcc -fpic -shared -ansi -Wall (Include dirs ...) -c sherwood.c

(where sherwood.c is my c function)

I compiled then my c++ function as it follows:
g++ -c provalib.cpp -I /usr/local/include/cantera

and tried to link them all by using ld:
ld -shared -L/usr/local/lib/cantera (libraries) -lm udf_names.o 
sherwood.o provalib.o -o libudf.so

Linking goes successful (even if "sherwood.c" compilation gives a 
warning of implicit declaration of the calling of c++ function), but 
when I try to import into fluent the libudf it gives a very strange 
and long string (in other words it doesn't work!)

I'm not a C/C++ programmer, then I don't control the ld flags: do I 
make a mistake there?
The other src/makefile statements I modified (besides your 
suggestions) are the followings:

OBJECTS= $(UDFDATA:.c=.o) $(SOURCES:.c=.o) $(CXX_SOURCES:.cpp=.o)

LDFLAGS_LNX86=		-shared 

.c.o:
	@echo "# Compiling $@ because of $?"
	@rm -f $*.o
	$(CC) $(CFLAGS) $(INCLUDES) -c $*.c
.cpp.o: 
	$(CXX) -c $< $(CXX_INCLUDES) #$(CXX_FLAGS)
	
default:  $(UDFDATA)
	@$(MAKE) $(ARCH)

$(TARGET): makefile $(UDFDATA) $(OBJECTS)
	@echo "# Linking $@ because of $?"
	$(LD) $(LDFLAGS) $(MY_LIB) $(OBJECTS) -o $@

Thank you very much again for your time. Vincenzo.
